summary: This is a joint letter from the prosecution and defense in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell requesting a one-week extension to file a joint letter regarding the pretrial schedule. The parties report having had a 45-minute productive discussion but still have multiple points of disagreement.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, to whom the joint request for an extension is addressed.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused in the criminal case referenced (20 Cr. 330 (MN)). She is the subject of the proceedings for which the pretrial schedule is being discussed.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who is respectfully submitting this joint request on behalf of the prosecution.

connections.description: Strauss, as United States Attorney, is leading the prosecution against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.
Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against defendant Maxwell.

events.title: Court Order on Pretrial Schedule
events.description: The Court issued an order requiring the parties to submit a joint letter regarding the overall pretrial schedule.

events.title: Parties' Telephone Conference
events.description: The prosecution and defense conferred for approximately 45 minutes by telephone regarding the pretrial schedule. The conversation was productive but multiple points of disagreement remain.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The document is a joint request from both the prosecution and defense in the Ghislaine Maxwell case for a one-week extension to file a joint pretrial schedule letter.
The parties had a 45-minute conference but still have multiple points of disagreement on the pretrial schedule that may require court resolution.
The case is United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, docket number 20 Cr. 330 (MN), being heard in the Southern District of New York before Judge Alison J. Nathan.
The request indicates ongoing, active pretrial preparation and negotiation between the government and Maxwell's defense team.
